references.formattedCitation: Wikipedia: The Free Encyclopedia That Anyone Can Edit. Wikimedia Foundation, 2001. https://en.wikipedia.org.

description: A coastal deme of the tribe Aigeis, in Attica, located on the eastern shore north of Brauron. The site was known in antiquity for its sanctuary dedicated to Artemis Tauropolos.
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Loutsa [II - coast - 5]

names.description: The name of the modern village overlying ancient Halai Araphenides until 1981, when it was renamed Artemida in honour of the area's ancient cult of Artemis.
